result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice A Shegonee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 84 days only if revoked.
Concurrent with: Jail time on 15CM208

miscConds.notes: The commitment order for non-payment is to run consecutive to any jail time that the defendant is serving.

The defendant must obtain his high school diploma or HSED/GED.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant must not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.
The defendant must submit a DNA sample.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
Huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.09(7m).
Concurrent with: Jail time on 15CM208

As deemed appropriate by P&P.

Must be completed within the first year of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maurice A Shegonee

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 2, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
From Attorney Cveykus requesting DE be allowed to transfer to MSDF - Judge would like an order to be drafted. JA faxed information to Attorney and DA.

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 4:10 PM. State - resolved. Cveykus - 16CF15 - plead G to count #1 as alleged; 15CM208 - amend count #1 to county ordinance of obstructing an officer with a fine of $500 plus costs, plead to count #2 as alleged - 60 days jail in FC jail, plus costs, on 16CF15 - joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 3 year with conditions of: 180 days jail of conditional jail, reimburse Forest County Drug Task Force of $150.00, employment/school, absolute sobriety, AODA and follow t hru, 84 days credit on 16CF15 only if revoked and no credit on 15CM208, asking for 60 days to be concurrent to probation. State's intent was for the probation to be consecutive to jail time. Cveykus responds. Cveykus and Shegonee agree with agreement as stated. State also asking for 300 hours of community service and obtain GED/HSED or high school diploma. Cveykus and Shegonee have no objections to those additional conditions. Court dismisses and reads in count #2 on 16CF15. Shegonee pleads G to count #1 as alleged on 16CF15. Court - 15CM208 - amend count #1 to ordinance violation of resisting an officer, pleads G, finds G, fine of $500.00 plus costs totalling $834.50 - 60 DTP/CO - consecutive to any jail time being served. Shegonee pleads G to count #2 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Cveykus makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Shegonee makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CM208 - count #2 - 60 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3), costs - paid within 60 days/CO; 16CF15 - #1 - withhold sentece and place on probation for 3 years - concurrent on sentence in 15CM208 -  with conditions of: 180 days jail - huber allowed - concurrent to jail time on 15CM208 - eligible for community service under 973.09(7m), $150.00 costs to Forest County Drug Task Force - 60 DTP/CO, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 150 hours of community service - to be completed within first year of probation, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, obtain HSED/GED or HS diploma, AODA and follow thru, costs - 60 DTP/CO, 84 days credit if revoked, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, no possession of firearms and no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on April 6, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 10:58 AM. 16CF15 PH will be waived. 15CM208 - here for FPT, is not resolved. 16CF15 - Court goes over waiver of PH form with defendant and finds he is freely and voluntairly waiving his right to a PH. Finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Info filed, mirrors. Proceed to ARGN. Cveykus waives further reading of information and enters NG pleas to all counts. Bond continued. Final pre-trial scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in custody from FC jail, in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called 15CM208 and 16CF15 at 9:54 AM. State did not send an offer on 15CM208 and here for AIA on 16CF15. Cveykus has complaint on 16CF15, waives further reading of it, waives time limits. Court considers time limits waived and will set 16CF15 for PH. Cveykus makes statement prior to setting it for PH, wants defendant to go into inpatient in April. Court continues bond on both matters, sets 16CF15 for PH and sets 15CM208 for another final pre-trial scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.  16CF15 - Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:45 AM. Shegonee has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Shegonee understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, can afford his own. Court sets for AIA and gives warning of appearing without an attorney at next hearing. State - bond - $2000.00 cash for stated reasons. Court asks defendant if he is sitting on a P&P hold. Defendant not sure. Court - bond - $2000.00 cash, no consumption of alcohol. Court can rere-visit bond once an attorney is retained.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 09:15 am.
